metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7831 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability where the security wrapper does not deny access to some exposed properties using the deprecated "_exposedProps_" mechanism on proxy objects. These properties should be explicitly unavailable to proxy objects. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 57.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7831` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-globalmenu - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-mozsymbols - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-testsuite - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine chrisccoulson> This is not fixed in mozjs52, but it's unclear whether it is unaffected or just ignored as https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1392026 is still private and I can't find a changeset referencing it)

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5').
